intro: Cassiope macrantha, commonly known as the mountain heath, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Africa. It is a member of the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in well-drained, acidic soils and thrives in cool, moist environments. Its small, clustered flowers are usually pink or white, and it produces small, fleshy berries that are an important food source for local wildlife. Cassiope macrantha is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and adaptability to rocky garden settings.
